item.title: Dangerous manhole cover, 5th November
item.description:
Poorly installed manhole cover loose & damaged tarmac all around. Dangerous to motorcycles & potential to damage other vehicles

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Avenue, Widmore, London

item.title: Damaged traffic light near Salvation Army, 5th November
item.description:
One of the traffic lights here appears to be damaged and looks less secure than it should be. It seems to have been hit or twisted, and it’s now leaning at an odd angle. It should be checked before it becomes a safety hazard for both drivers and pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haverstock Hill, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Corner of Chalcot Sq near number 21, 5th November
item.description:
The drain in the lower section of the square near number 21 is currently blocked. This area is prone to flooding due to its dropped level, so the drain needs to be cleared as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chalcot Square, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Surplus bins and fly tipping, 5th November
item.description:
The brown bin and two green bins at this location are surplus to requirements. The brown bin does not have a sticker and has been used for general waste. Residents' bins are now being kept in the alleyway behind the shops and in courtyards to the homes, so all bins left on the pavement here need to be removed, together with the fly-tipping which they are attracting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Howletts Road, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, 5th November
item.description:

item.title: Rubbish stuffed in a hole, 5th November
item.description:
This refers to some kind of redundant cabinet associated with Network Rail. The cabinet is behind the fence alongside the railway line but has a hole that opens onto the pavement and which is stuffed with rubbish. Please can the rubbish be removed and network rail instructed to remove or cap the cabinet in order that people can nolonger stuff rubbish into it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Half Moon Lane, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Yellow lines degecrive, 5th November
item.description:
I live at 31 Rowanwood Avenue. When the recent yellow lines were pointed, there was a car parked in the bend. The yellow lines were appointed either side of the parked car. So we now have a car paring regularly between the lines in a dangerous spot. The lines need to made continuous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, 72, Rowanwood Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
